title: PAD London jewellery highlights: from Taffin's European debut to Boghossian's astonishing gems
text:
If there’s one thing I like almost as much as looking at gorgeous stuff, it’s looking at people looking at gorgeous stuff, and now’s the time for that in London. While Goldsmith’s Fair is great for spotting craft fanatics who bring their own jewellers’ loupes to get a close-up view of the work, PAD is best for spotting well-heeled, cultured types who know as much about modernist furniture as they do about mid-century lighting.

Increasingly, the Berkeley Square fair is also a great place to see some really fantastic, independent jewellers’ work, much of which you can’t just wander into a store to purchase.
